body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue
installation seemingly works fine:
```console
$ spack install xgboost
```
until I check what is under the prefix directory: apparently the folder ".../xgboost/dmlc-core/include" from the source files was put under prefix/include and ".../xgboost/dmlc-core/libdmlc.a" was put in prefix/lib as opposed to the target file "libxgboost.so"

### Platform and user environment

```commandline
$ uname -a
Linux storm 4.15.0-38-generic #41-Ubuntu SMP Wed Oct 10 10:59:38 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
 $ lsb_release -d
Description:	Linux Mint 19 Tara (same as Ubuntu bionic (18.04.1))
``` 
### Additional information
I will be creating a PR shortly to fix the problem.
title: installation issue: xgboost (the wrong stuff is installed under prefix)
